alert.note: Alert for Charles City; City of Williamsburg; James City; Surry; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 10:50AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and southeast Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, in east central Virginia, Charles City. In southeast Virginia, City of Williamsburg, James City, Surry and York. * WHEN...Until 300 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1050 AM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Williamsburg, Claremont, Surry, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Gloucester Point, Dendron, Scotland, Jamestown, Kings Point, Elberon, Carver Gardens, York Terrace, Busch Gardens, Grove, Alliance, Governors Land, Chippokes State Park, Williamsburg Airport and Beachland. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; City of Williamsburg; James City; Surry; York
